==Trivia==
* {{w|Malinalco_(archeological_site)|Malinalco}} is a an archeological site located in Malinalco, Mexico, Mexico. 
**This place was one of the most important Aztec sites, and one of its most important buildings is a Cuauhcalli (House of the Eagles) which was used as a sanctuary for the ''Cuauhpilli'' (Eagle warrior) and ''Ocelopilli'' (Jaguar warrior) for rites such as initiation. 
===Etymology===
* The name comes from the {{w|Nahuatl}} words: ''malinalli'' which is a grass known as "Zacate del carbonero;" ''xochitl'' meaning "flower;" and ''co'' meaning "place."
* Malinalco's name alludes to ''Malinalxóchitl'' (Usually translated as “the place where Malinalxóchitl lives," “where she is worshipped” or in turn “the malinalli flower”) goddess of witchcraft and fateful divination, sister of Huitzilopochtli and Coyolxauhqui.
